heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 29 October 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (230.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 6.0°C), outside temperature (down 5.4°C), and inside temperature (down 2.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 122 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 7.6°C), dew point temperature (up 5.9°C), outside temperature (up 6.9°C), and cloud levels (up 295 m) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 121.7m lower than yesterday, 217.9m lower than the past week, 294.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 869m and a peak of 1350m, averaging 978.8m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and little or no wind. Chance of light rain, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and it’s dark. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
